# Chief Intelligence Officer - Daily Brief
**Topic**: Latest global political and military news
**Time**: 2026/2/19 20:11

## Situation Overview
Welcome to the Daily News Channel, I'm Joe. Today is February 19, 2026. In the following segment, I will review 20 major events that have impacted global processes in the past 24 hours. Currently, the world is at a crossroads of multiple geopolitical crises: in the Middle East, a conflict between the US and Iran seems imminent, and the situation in the Gulf is more urgent than ever before; in Eurasia, the diplomatic maneuvering between Russia and Ukraine is proceeding simultaneously with NATO's defense restructuring; and in the Asia-Pacific region, from high-value energy agreements to emerging trade agreements, the economic and trade front of great power competition is expanding. Furthermore, the race for cutting-edge technologies such as hypersonic weapons and artificial intelligence is profoundly rewriting the logic of modern warfare. Today's program will take you deep into the truth behind this series of upheavals, from the White House Situation Room to maritime conferences in the Indian Ocean, from market forecasts for hypersonic missiles to potential personnel changes at the European Central Bank, presenting you with a detailed picture of the global situation. Please listen to the detailed report.

## Key Intelligence
### 1. The risk of a full-scale war between the US and Iran has increased sharply, and the US military plans to launch a military strike this weekend.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: TBS News, Axios, Daily Mail
- **Summary**: According to our combined reports, the situation between the US and Iran has teetered on the brink of full-scale war. Latest intelligence indicates that the US military could launch a military strike against targets within Iran as early as this weekend. Senior officials in the Trump administration have held multiple closed-door meetings in the White House Situation Room to discuss operational plans that could last for weeks. According to reports from Axios and other media outlets, the probability of war between the US and Iran is currently assessed at 90%. As a deterrent, the US military has urgently deployed the USS Abraham Lincoln and USS Ford carrier strike groups to the Middle East and mobilized advanced fighter jets such as the F-35 and F-22. Iran, on the other hand, is responding with "asymmetric deterrence," deploying more than 20 Ghadir-class midget submarines in the Persian Gulf. Affected by the looming threat of war, international oil prices have risen by 2%.
- **References**:
  - [1] [TBS News](https://www.tbsnews.net/world/us-military-preparing-potentially-weeks-long-iran-operations-1361146)
  - [2] [Axios](https://en.ilsole24ore.com/art/axios-us-attack-on-iran-90-per-cent-probability-large-scale-war-may-begin-very-soon-AILfQOUB)

### 2. The US accuses China of conducting secret nuclear tests, extending the strategic rivalry between the two countries into the space domain.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 南华早报 (SCMP)
- **Summary**: According to the South China Morning Post, the clashes between China and the US over nuclear arms control have intensified since the New START Treaty between the US and Russia expired. Washington recently publicly accused China of conducting "secret nuclear tests," which China firmly refuted. Meanwhile, the competition between the two sides has extended to low Earth orbit. China emphasized that to counter the military applications of US commercial space technology such as SpaceX, it is necessary to accelerate the integration of commercial spaceflight with military systems. On the diplomatic front, Wang Yi reiterated during the Munich Security Conference that the future of Sino-US relations depends on the US's willingness to cooperate. Furthermore, although the US signed an agreement that lowered tariff barriers for Taiwan, the current diplomatic focus remains on the planned meeting between the Chinese and US leaders in April.
- **References**:
  - [1] [南华早报 (SCMP)](https://www.scmp.com/topics/us-china-relations)

### 3. The Geneva talks between Russia and Ukraine continue, with the EU assessing the losses suffered by the Russian military during four years of war.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Bloomberg, EU Agenda
- **Summary**: According to the latest report from this station, delegations from Ukraine and Russia are continuing consultations in Geneva on preliminary ceasefire terms. Although Zelensky accused Russia of deliberately delaying the process, diplomatic communication channels remain open. Meanwhile, the European External Action Service released a detailed list of losses. Data shows that in the four years since the start of the war, Russian military casualties have exceeded 1.2 million, 29 ships have been destroyed, and the economy has shrunk under continued sanctions. However, the report indicates that Russia is still able to maintain strong military pressure. The EU emphasized that in the face of a protracted geopolitical conflict, Europe will be more united than ever before and will continue to support Ukraine's democratic defense system.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/feeds/sitemap_news.xml)
  - [2] [EU Agenda](https://euagenda.eu/videos)

### 4. The US and Japan reach a $36 billion energy deal, strengthening their strategic alliance in the Indo-Pacific region.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Bloomberg, SCMP
- **Summary**: According to Bloomberg, Japan and the United States recently reached a $36 billion strategic agreement covering natural gas and key minerals. This is a "gift package" prepared by the Trump administration for Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's visit to the United States, including the construction of liquefied natural gas (LNG) facilities and power plants in the US. This move aims to secure bilateral energy security and address the growing security challenges in the Indo-Pacific region. Meanwhile, the US Department of Defense recently canceled cooperation with some Ivy League universities, citing their inability to meet current high standards of defense readiness. These developments indicate that the United States is accelerating the restructuring of its overseas alliance system through a dual commitment to energy and defense.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/feeds/sitemap_news.xml)
  - [2] [SCMP](https://www.scmp.com/news/asia/east-asia)

### 5. India plays a bridging role in a multipolar world, demonstrating its unique strategic influence.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 纽约时报 (NYT)
- **Summary**: According to an analysis by The New York Times, against the backdrop of increasingly fierce competition among the three major powers—the US, China, and Russia—India, as the world's fastest-growing economy, is demonstrating remarkable diplomatic flexibility. A prominent international relations scholar assesses that the current global order is shifting towards a "multi-faceted, complex world," and India, by maintaining partnerships with the Putin government while simultaneously negotiating multilateral deals with the Trump administration, is gradually altering the traditional bipolar world order. Analysts point out that this "transactional" diplomatic model may shift geopolitical dominance over the next 30 years towards highly autonomous major powers, with India becoming a key force in this transformation.
- **References**:
  - [1] [纽约时报 (NYT)](https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/19/opinion/interesting-times-amitav-acharya.html)

### 6. The United States released its 2026 National Defense Strategy, which plans to reduce NATO's troop presence on its eastern flank.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: BeHorizon, Mezha.net
- **Summary**: According to the latest U.S. National Defense Strategy for 2026 (NDS), the White House is shifting its defense positioning towards Europe from "permanent assurance" to "selective engagement." As observed by this station, a direct result of this strategic shift is the U.S. plan to withdraw approximately 800 military personnel from NATO's eastern flank, including Romania. The U.S. Department of Defense is demanding that European allies shoulder a greater defense burden. In response, the EU stated that despite the U.S. military adjustments, its own eastern flank defense roadmap will remain unchanged, and it plans to launch a new monitoring project in the first quarter of 2026. NATO points out that the total size of U.S. troops stationed in Europe remains relatively high in recent years.
- **References**:
  - [1] [BeHorizon](https://behorizon.org/europe-and-the-2026-u-s-defense-strategy/)
  - [2] [Mezha.net](https://mezha.net/eng/bukvy/eu-maintains-defense-plans-amid-us-troop-reductions-on-nato-eastern-flank/)

### 7. NATO plans to deploy a drone defense system on its eastern flank by mid-2026.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Euractiv
- **Summary**: According to Euractiv, a senior NATO commander recently revealed that, in response to the growing hybrid threats on the modern battlefield, NATO plans to fully integrate unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) swarm systems into its eastern flank defense system by mid-2026. This move aims to leverage high technology to address the shortcomings of frontline troops in aerial surveillance and rapid response. Currently, EU member states are also engaged in in-depth discussions regarding the new role of the border management agency Frontex in border defense and responding to hybrid warfare. This signifies NATO's attempt to fill the defense vacuum left by the partial withdrawal of US troops through technological upgrades.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Euractiv](https://www.euractiv.com/interview/nato-to-embed-drones-in-eastern-flank-defences-by-mid-2026-says-top-commander/)

### 8. Trump launches Gaza "peace committee," UN Security Council expresses concern.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 纽约时报, TBS News
- **Summary**: According to this station, US President Trump has officially launched a new body called the "Peace Commission" in Washington, aimed at advancing the second phase of Hamas's disarmament plan in the Gaza Strip. While some allies, including Pakistan, attended the launch ceremony, traditional allies such as France, Canada, and Japan showed a lukewarm reception. Meanwhile, the UN Security Council has expressed serious concern. According to Security Council data, since the ceasefire agreement was signed, Israel's military operation in Gaza has resulted in 601 deaths. Representatives from several Security Council members have strongly criticized Israel's expansionist plans in the West Bank, believing that this further jeopardizes the already bleak prospects for regional peace.
- **References**:
  - [1] [TBS News](https://www.tbsnews.net/hamas-israel-war/trump-kicks-his-board-peace-eye-gaza-and-beyond-1365861)
  - [2] [纽约时报](https://www.nytimes.com/2026/02/18/world/middleeast/security-council-israel-gaza-board-peace.html)

### 9. The situation in the West Bank escalates as Israeli forces forcibly demolish homes, prompting diplomatic mediation.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Arab News, Al Arabiya
- **Summary**: According to Arab News, the situation in Hebron, a region in the West Bank, has deteriorated sharply in the past 24 hours. The Israeli army forcibly demolished a multi-story residential complex belonging to the Salhab family, directly displacing more than 40 civilians. Meanwhile, far-right Israeli cabinet members are pushing hard for a "voluntary migration" plan targeting Palestinians in Gaza and the West Bank, sparking strong international protests. In the diplomatic arena, Bahrain and Egypt are attempting to mediate the increasingly open conflict between Saudi Arabia and the UAE over regional security policies, making the rebalancing of interests within the Middle East exceptionally complex.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Arab News](https://www.arabnews.pk/node/2633530/middle-east)
  - [2] [Al Arabiya](https://english.alarabiya.net/News/middle-east/2026/02/18/top-israeli-minister-pushes-for-emigration-of-west-bank-gaza-palestinians-)

### 10. A British couple was sentenced to ten years in prison in Tehran; Iran held an anti-American seminar.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: ITV, ABNA
- **Summary**: According to ITV, an Iranian court recently sentenced a British couple, Lindsay and Craig Foreman, to 10 years in prison for espionage. The couple were arrested in early 2025 while traveling in Iran, and their family maintains their innocence. On the same day as the sentencing, Iranian officials held the 12th International Conference on "American-Style Human Rights" in the holy city of Qom. The conference focused on criticizing the so-called "US-Israel conspiracy" and described Western human rights standards as tools for interfering in the internal affairs of other countries. This series of actions is seen as a strong political signal from Tehran to Western countries amid the impasse in nuclear negotiations.
- **References**:
  - [1] [ITV](https://www.itv.com/news/2026-02-18/british-couple-detained-in-iran-sentenced-to-ten-years-family-say)
  - [2] [ABNA](https://en.abna24.com/)

### 11. Navies from 14 Indian Ocean nations gathered in Goa to discuss maritime security cooperation.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Deccan Herald
- **Summary**: According to a report by Deccan Herald, the 2026 Goa Maritime Conference officially opened yesterday in India. Naval representatives from 14 countries in the Indian Ocean region attended, with the core issue focusing on how to jointly address the increasingly complex regional maritime challenges. The conference emphasized that, in the face of piracy, smuggling, and the security of shipping lanes amidst great power competition, member states must strengthen intelligence sharing and joint patrols. Analysts point out that this conference reflects India's role as a "net provider" of regional security, aiming to maintain the stability of the Indian Ocean, a core global trade route, through the establishment of multilateral alliances.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Deccan Herald](https://www.deccanherald.com/india/navies-of-14-indian-ocean-nations-to-meet-in-goa-to-focus-on-shared-maritime-challenges-3902915)

### 12. The hypersonic defense market has exceeded 1.7 billion yuan, and China's new test has attracted the attention of the United States.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Yahoo Finance, The Defense Watch
- **Summary**: According to a recent industry report, the global market for hypersonic missile defense systems will exceed $1.75 billion by 2026. The research indicates that hypersonic weapons have moved from the laboratory to the battlefield, their low-altitude gliding and high maneuverability disrupting traditional defense assumptions. The report specifically focuses on China's recent test of a hypersonic missile with a "low trajectory," a technology that significantly shortens the radar detection window. In response, the US and Europe are accelerating the development of AI-based multi-sensor fusion tracking technology and directed-energy weapons. Artificial intelligence is being deeply integrated into ballistic prediction and electronic warfare systems, aiming to make interception decisions in extremely short time.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Yahoo Finance](https://finance.yahoo.com/news/hypersonic-missile-defence-systems-research-115200758.html)
  - [2] [The Defense Watch](https://thedefensewatch.com/military-ordnance/hypersonic-weapons-race-u-s-russia-china/)

### 13. Jane's Defence Report Released: Global Defence Technology Supply Chain Transforms Towards AI
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Janes
- **Summary**: In its latest Global Dynamics report, authoritative defense agency Janes revealed a series of cutting-edge military advancements. Among them, the Excalibur flight test aircraft debuted a new fairing for the "Storm" system, marking the maturity of next-generation fighter jet communication suites. In the field of unmanned systems, BAE Systems Australia conducted trials of the ATLAS collaborative combat vehicle, while Indian companies developed a dedicated anti-drone system for low-altitude airspace. The report also mentioned that Qatar's new fast attack ship has been officially launched, and Kuwait has opened a new munitions factory. This reflects a shift in the global defense supply chain's focus towards critical materials supply and AI infrastructure development.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Janes](https://www.janes.com/osint-insights/defence-news)

### 14. The refit plan for the Russian cruiser "Peter the Great" has been revealed, fully compatible with hypersonic weapons.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Military Review (TopWar.ru)
- **Summary**: According to a report by this station citing Russia's *Military Review*, details of the modernization of the Russian Navy's nuclear-powered cruiser *Peter the Great* have recently been revealed. The ship will follow the upgrade path of the *Admiral Nakhimov*, with the core objective of enhancing its long-range missile strike capabilities. The refitted cruiser will prioritize the installation of modern layered air defense and anti-submarine systems and will be fully compatible with Russian-made hypersonic missiles. Furthermore, the naval guns will be replaced with the more balanced A-192 system to reduce the load on the ship's hull. This large-scale upgrade aims to adapt this "sea behemoth" to the demands of modern naval warfare for high-speed, highly maneuverable strike capabilities.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Military Review](https://en.topwar.ru/277480-tark-petr-velikij-stanet-koroche-i-opasnee.html)

### 15. US-Iran nuclear negotiations stalled, and India, in coordination with sanctions, seized an Iranian oil tanker.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: Trading Economics, Geopolitics Unplugged
- **Summary**: According to our latest market analysis, despite recent reports of progress in nuclear negotiations causing fluctuations in the prices of safe-haven assets such as gold, the situation on the ground remains highly tense. The US Treasury Department continues to increase pressure on Iran and its "shadow fleet." Latest news indicates that India, in February, cooperated with US sanctions enforcement, seizing several vessels suspected of illegally transporting Iranian oil in its waters. Experts point out that due to Iran's high-intensity asymmetric military deployment in the Strait of Hormuz, if nuclear negotiations ultimately break down, the supply premium in the crude oil market is expected to rise instantly by 5% to 10%.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Trading Economics](https://tradingeconomics.com/commodity/gold/news/526501)
  - [2] [Geopolitics Unplugged](https://geopoliticsunplugged.substack.com/p/20-iranian-mini-subs-russian-corvette)

### 16. Indonesia and the United States sign reciprocal trade agreement to offset the impact of 19% tariffs
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: 星报 (The Star)
- **Summary**: According to The Star, the Indonesian government officially signed the Reciprocal Trade Agreement (ART) in Washington today. Under the agreement, most Indonesian exports to the United States will face a 19% tariff, a rate higher than India's but on par with Malaysia's. In exchange, Indonesia agreed to eliminate tariffs on 99% of its U.S. imports. Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto emphasized that the negotiating team maintained a high degree of caution during implementation, aiming to ensure that domestic industrial productivity is not affected by uncompetitive goods. The signing of this agreement marks a shift in Southeast Asian countries' efforts to mitigate the economic pressure of high tariffs through bilateral agreements under the Trump administration's new trade policies.
- **References**:
  - [1] [星报 (The Star)](https://www.thestar.com.my/business/business-news/2026/02/19/officials-urge-caution-ahead-of-us-agreement)

### 17. IMF assesses Japan's economic performance: demonstrating resilience amid high tariffs.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: 国际货币基金组织 (IMF)
- **Summary**: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) released its annual assessment of the Japanese economy at a press conference yesterday. Despite the current uncertainty surrounding US tariff policies, the IMF raised its 2026 economic growth forecast for Japan to 0.8%. The IMF's Japan team leader noted that Japan has successfully buffered the impact of external trade protectionism through sound fiscal policies and structural reforms, demonstrating "impressive" resilience. This positive assessment not only boosts investor confidence in the Japanese market but also provides important economic support data for Sanae Takaichi's upcoming visit to Washington.
- **References**:
  - [1] [国际货币基金组织 (IMF)](https://www.imf.org/en/news/articles/2026/02/18/tr-02162026-imf-japan-aiv-press-conference)

### 18. The US tightens its economic blockade against Cuba, and a European energy pipeline malfunction triggers a supply crisis.
- **Time**: 2026-02-18
- **Source**: 台北时报, Geopolitics Unplugged
- **Summary**: According to the Taipei Times, the Trump administration has recently intensified its blockade against Cuba, focusing on the country's pillar industries: oil supplies, tourism, and tobacco. Washington has made it clear that this move aims to bring about regime change in Cuba. Meanwhile, on the other side of the Atlantic, Europe is also facing significant changes in its energy supply chain. Due to an emergency malfunction in the Druzhba oil pipeline, the EU has initiated repair plans and is attempting to find alternative routes. While this is ostensibly for "repairs," it is also interpreted as a means for the EU to accelerate the elimination of sanctions exemptions for countries like Hungary and Slovakia. If alternative solutions are not found in time, these countries will face significant energy supply gaps.
- **References**:
  - [1] [台北时报](https://www.taipeitimes.com/News/biz)
  - [2] [Geopolitics Unplugged](https://geopoliticsunplugged.substack.com/p/20-iranian-mini-subs-russian-corvette)

### 19. Trump warns Britain: Strictly prohibit the transfer of sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Plataforma Media
- **Summary**: According to this station, US President Trump recently posted a message on social media urging the British government to withdraw its proposal to transfer sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius. Trump harshly criticized the plan as a "serious strategic mistake" that would directly harm the core security interests of both the US and the UK. He specifically emphasized the irreplaceable importance of Diego Garcia, which currently hosts a vital military base shared by both the US and the UK. This statement demonstrates the Trump administration's hardline stance on control of global strategic strongholds, preferring to interfere in the sovereignty decisions of its allies rather than allow Diego Garcia to face any potential legal uncertainties.
- **References**:
  - [1] [Plataforma Media](https://www.plataformamedia.com/en/2026/02/19/trump-warns-uk-against-handing-over-chagos-islands-citing-strategic-importance-of-diego-garcia/)

### 20. Lagarde may step down as central bank governor ahead of schedule; the limitations of the sanctions model have prompted academic reflection.
- **Time**: 2026-02-19
- **Source**: Le Monde, Russia Matters
- **Summary**: According to the French newspaper Le Monde, rumors are circulating that European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde may resign early, a potential personnel upheaval occurring at a critical time for Europe in dealing with US tariff pressure. Meanwhile, academia is also questioning the current global governance model. An analysis published in Foreign Affairs points out that in a multipolar world, the traditional "sanctions-regime change" formula is increasingly ineffective. Economic sanctions from a single country are being offset by emerging alternative trade networks, such as the INSTC (International North-South Transport Corridor). The analysis warns that if the international community does not adjust its existing confrontational logic, geopolitics may descend into a disorderly game of "voluntary alliances."
- **References**:
  - [1] [世界报 (Le Monde)](https://www.lemonde.fr/en/economy/article/2026/02/19/christine-lagarde-may-leave-european-central-bank-before-end-of-term_6750632_19.html)
  - [2] [Russia Matters](https://www.russiamatters.org/news/russia-analytical-report/russia-analytical-report-feb-9-17-2026)
